DataElement.preferredName: Emission Scan Post Radioactivity Acquisition Duration Minute Number
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The length or duration in minutes of the emission scan following the injection of radiotracer.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Emission Scan Post Radioactivity Acquisition Duration
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The usual mode of scanner operation in which a tracer's distribution throughout a subject is detected for subsequent processing into an image._Happening at a time subsequent to a reference time; later in time or order._The quality of emitting or the emission of corpuscular or electromagnetic radiations consequent to nuclear disintegration, a natural property of all chemical elements of atomic number above 83 and possible of induction in all other known elements._The amount of time elapsed during the capture of data.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The usual mode of scanner operation in which a tracer's distribution throughout a subject is detected for subsequent processing into an image.

Concepts.definition: The usual mode of scanner operation in which a tracer's distribution throughout a subject is detected for subsequent processing into an image.

Property.preferredDefinition: Happening at a time subsequent to a reference time; later in time or order.:The quality of emitting or the emission of corpuscular or electromagnetic radiations consequent to nuclear disintegration, a natural property of all chemical elements of atomic number above 83 and possible of induction in all other known elements.:The amount of time elapsed during the capture of data.

Concepts.definition: Happening at a time subsequent to a reference time; later in time or order.

The quality of emitting or the emission of corpuscular or electromagnetic radiations consequent to nuclear disintegration, a natural property of all chemical elements of atomic number above 83 and possible of induction in all other known elements.
The amount of time elapsed during the capture of data.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Events, people, materials and activities uniquely defined by medical imaging.
ConceptualDomain.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 10/8/13 created per Round 4 community review comment. jc

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Length or duration of an event or activity measured in minutes.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Tests, examinations, evaluations used to determine a subject's status or response to intervention.
ConceptualDomain.changeDescription: Created initially to support CCR value domain for CTMS.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A unit measure of time equal to 60 seconds.:Number; a concept of quantity derived from zero and units; a numeral or string of numerals that is used for identification.

Concepts.definition: A unit measure of time equal to 60 seconds.
A numeral or string of numerals expressing value, quantity, or identification.

DataElement.changeDescription: 10/8/13 created per Round 4 community review comment. jc
